title: Write Like You Hate It
description: Take an emotional scene and rewrite it like you're embarrassed to feel anything. Dry it out. Wring it flat.

variants.instructions: Rewrite your most emotional scene using only facts. No metaphors. No feelings. Just the events.
Keep the same scene, but rewrite it with a mean, cynical voice that mocks everything heartfelt in the original.
Rewrite it in distant third person, like a bored narrator watching ants fight.

title: Too Many Adjectives
description: Drown a basic scene in excessive adjectives and adverbs. Make it absolutely unreadable.

variants.instructions: Describe a room using at least 3 adjectives per noun. Every sentence should sound like it got rejected from a Victorian novel.
Use a simile in every single sentence, whether it makes sense or not. Make them ridiculous.
